channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live Briefing: Israeli airstrikes across Lebanon target Hezbollah financial operations
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Leo Sands, Jennifer Hassan, Missy Ryan, Louisa Loveluck
item.description: Smoke billowed above suburbs of the capital Beirut after Israel urged people to move away from branches of Al-Qard Al-Hasan, a Hezbollah-run financial institution.

item.title: Blinken heads to Middle East to push for end to war in Gaza
item.dc:creator: John Hudson

item.title: Amid uncertainty over U.S. backing, Pentagon chief visits Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan
item.description: The trip comes just two weeks before an election that could determine whether the United States continues its campaign of massive military support.

item.title: Analysis: What will Yahya Sinwar’s death mean for Gaza? Not peace.
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor

item.title: Fethullah Gulen, Muslim cleric and target of Turkey’s Erdogan, dies at 83
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Turkish authorities accused him of being the mastermind behind a 2016 coup attempt to topple the government of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

item.title: Australian senator heckles Charles: ‘You are not my king’
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: Indigenous lawmaker Lidia Thorpe was removed from an event at Australia’s Parliament after accusing the British royal family of “genocide” and stealing land.

item.title: BRICS is key to Putin’s fight against the U.S. Not all members agree.
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Katharine Houreld, Francesca Ebel, Karishma Mehrotra
item.description: With Putin confident of a Russian victory in Ukraine, this week’s BRICS summit is designed to send a message that Russia is back as a powerful global player.

item.title: Iran, weakened by attacks on its allies, braces for Israeli strikes
item.dc:creator: Susannah George

item.title: Propaganda war: Israel, Hamas battle over final images of Yahya Sinwar
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix

item.title: What will Yahya Sinwar’s death mean for Gaza? Not peace.
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: A cease-fire and hostage release deal doesn’t look that much more likely in the wake of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar’s death.

item.title: Israel launches strikes on Hezbollah financial system
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Kelly Kasulis Cho, Annabelle Timsit, Leo Sands, Kelsey Baker, Lior Soroka, Mohamad El Chamaa, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Explosions rocked Beirut’s southern suburbs and sites near the airport late Sunday after the Israeli military said it would begin targeting Hezbollah finances.

item.title: Propaganda war: Israel, Hamas battle over final images of Yahya Sinwar
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix
item.description: Israel is trying to portray images of the Hamas leader’s final moments as those of a fugitive. His supporters have seized on the same visuals to glorify him as a fighter.

item.title: Iran, weakened by attacks on its allies, braces for Israeli strikes
item.dc:creator: Susannah George
item.description: Israel plans to strike Iran in retaliation for a ballistic missile attack this month. Iranians fear the response will destabilize the economy and stir unrest.

item.title: Hezbollah and Israeli forces continue to exchange fire
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Abbie Cheeseman, Suzy Haidamous

item.title: Lebanese Christians, caught in crossfire, refuse to leave war zone
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman, Suzan Haidamous

item.title: Oxfam condemns killing of water workers amid Gaza’s humanitarian crisis
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho

item.title: U.S. and U.N. differ in assessments of current aid levels to Gaza
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan

item.title: Israeli strike kills at least 73 people in northern Gaza, medics say
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Heba Farouk Mahfouz , Hazem Balousha, Hajar Harb

item.title: Russia’s opposition abroad is tearing itself apart, but clings to hope
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Mary Ilyushina, Catherine Belton, Robyn Dixon
item.description: Many Russians who want to see change in their country are increasingly doubtful that the opposition in its current form can lead the fight to transform the country.

item.title: Israeli strike kills at least 73 people in northern Gaza, medics say
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Heba Farouk Mahfouz , Hazem Balousha, Hajar Harb
item.description: Israel’s military intensified operations there just days after Biden suggested the death of Hamas’s leader could usher in an end to the ruinous war.

item.title: Live Briefing: Drone ‘launched at’ Netanyahu’s home; North Gaza hospitals under fire, officials say
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables, Adela Suliman, Heba Farouk Mahfouz , Lior Soroka, Sammy Westfall
item.description: A drone was launched from Lebanon toward Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s residence in Caesarea area, officials said, adding that no casualties were reported.

item.title: IDF and Hezbollah continue trading attacks
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall

item.title: U.S. and U.N. differ in assessments of current aid levels to Gaza
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan

item.title: Dog spotted atop ancient Egyptian pyramid delights paragliders
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: Video of the dog went viral after social media users were charmed by footage of it running around and barking at the top of an archeological marvel.

item.title: Three killed as hospitals come under fire in northern Gaza, officials say
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables, Heba Farouk Mahfouz , Adela Suliman
